meanings.definition: The ability to float or rise in a liquid or gas.
meanings.sent1: The buoyances of the boat allowed it to stay afloat in the water.
meanings.sent2: The helium balloon's buoyances made it rise effortlessly into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The buoyances of the rubber duckies in the bathtub always bring a smile to my face.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was like the buoyances of a life jacket, keeping her spirits up.
meanings.sent5: The buoyances of the bubbles in the soda were mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: The quality of being cheerful or optimistic.
meanings.sent1: His buoyances were contagious, spreading joy to everyone around him.
meanings.sent2: Despite the challenges, her buoyances never wavered, always looking on the bright side.
meanings.sent3: The buoyances of the clown at the party had everyone laughing with delight.
meanings.sent4: Her buoyances shone through like a beacon of hope in the midst of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The buoyances of the children playing in the park were a sight to behold.
